Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: American Institute in Taiwan, Department of State
Additional Scope Comments: 1.  The Department may decide to use item 012 in the future and will submit a new form at that time.2.  Scope of RG 475 is for American Institute in Taiwan (AIT) only.  General State Department records are in RG 059 and RG 084.3. Cutoff and transfer instructions for GRS 6.1, item 10 - Cut off at the end of tenure. Transfer to the National Archives 25 years after cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: The Department will be applying GRS 6.1 item 010 and item 011 beginning on December 31, 2016 and continuing day forward for all emails. Pursuant to question 22, section A in the aforementioned FAQ guidance, the Department will also be using GRS 5.2, item 010 as part of its culling strategy. The Department will be applying GRS 6.1, item 010 to any existing legacy senior official’s emails, including its email collection that was previously maintained on disc commonly referred to as Cable Archive Retrieval System. This reflects the Department’s effort to ensure as much permanently valuable email will be transferred to NARA as possible. The Department will not be applying GRS 6.1, item 011 or item 012 for temporary legacy emails created before December 31, 2016. The Department will be applying its other approved disposition authorities for these records pursuant to question 22, section B in the aforementioned FAQ.  Please note, the Department routinely communicated with its employees concerning their records management responsibilities through Cables and Department Notices which required each employee to print-and-file and/or cross-file email records.

Additional Scope Comments: The Executive Committee (Category 2) are second tier managers within the RRB that report directly to the three-member Board and:      • Oversees day-to-day operations of the RRB in conformance with existing laws, regulations, and policies as well as orders administered         or promulgated by the Board Members.    • Makes recommendations to the Board Members on agency-related policy issues.    • Promotes coordination and communication on matters of agency-wide policy and direction.The Senior Executive Officer position is rotated between the Executive Committee .  The Director of Field Service (Category 2) is currently serving as the Senior Executive Officer.  However, the Senior Executive Officer and Executive Committee positions do not have a separate email account. Secretary to the Board (Category 4) has an rrb.gov and group mailboxes.
Cutoff Instructions: Cut off Capstone Official email at the end of the calendar year.
Transfer Instructions: Transfer to the National Archives and Records Administration 25 years after cut off.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email for GRS 6.1, Item 010 dating back to approximately 1998.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO)
Cutoff Instructions: Capstone Officials: Top-Level Agency Resources email records are considered permanent records and will be retained for 15 years before being transferred to NARA. Cut-off annually at the end of each calendar year. Non-Capstone Officials:  All other Agency personnel to include administrative personnel and employees and contractors will be retained under the General Records Retention Schedule (GRS),  item 11.  This category includes all email records considered temporary records and will be retained for 7 years.  Cut-off at the end of each calendar year.  Delete when 7 years old.  These email records will never be transferred to NARA, but deleted at the end of their retention period.  Exceptions:  Agency Examiners and Examining Attorneys,  and other Office of General Counsel employees as determined by OGC authorized personnel where email records are considered a temporary record will be retained for 20 years.  Cut-off at the end of each calendar year.  Delete when 20 years old.  Email records identified in this category will never be transferred to NARA, but deleted at the end of their retention period.
Transfer Instructions: Transfer when 15 years old. After coordination with NARA to confirm the successful transfer, all emails will be deleted from the agency enterprise system.
Legacy Email Scope: GRS 6.1 will be applied to all legacy emails dating back to 2002.  USPTO has identified emails in the current system dating back to 2002.  Prior to 2002 the print and file method was the advised method for collecting substantive emails.
URL to Agency Organization Chart: https://www.uspto.gov/about-us/executive-biographies  (equals org. executive leadership) (click on org. offices internet for more)
Whom should NARA contact if there any qu: Marcie Lovett, Director Records Information Governance Division  marcie.lovett@uspto.gov  571-272-0163

Additional Scope Comments: 1.  The number of positions identified on the NA 1005 may not always match the number of accounts being actively journaled. This is due to vacant positions or because one person may be serving in multiple roles, e.g., the Under Secretary for Management also occupies the Chief Financial Officer role. 2. The planned email management system will be deployed Agency-wide.  However, a separate NA 1005 is being submitted for overseas posts because they are part of a separate record group (RG 084).3. The Department may decide to use item 012 in the future and will submit a new form at that time.  4. Positions listed in Category 2 are those considered broadly equivalent to an Assistant Secretary.5.  Positions listed in Category 3 are those considered broadly equivalent to a Deputy Assistant Secretary.6. Positions that might fall under Categories 5, 6, 8 and 9, are included in our listings for Categories 2 and 3 due to their elevated billet within the Department of State. 7.  Certain positions have an additional classified account (three total) due to the nature of their work.  These positions have been identified for S, D, M, INR, and DS and are reflected within the account totals.Cutoff Instructions for GRS 6.1, item 10  - Cut off at the end of tenure. Transfer to the National Archives 25 years after cut off.
Legacy Email Scope: The Department will be applying GRS 6.1 item 010 and item 011 beginning on December 31, 2016 and continuing day forward for all emails. Pursuant to question 22, section A in the aforementioned FAQ guidance, the Department will also be using GRS 23, item 7 as part of its culling strategy. The Department will be applying GRS 6.1, item 010 to any existing legacy senior official’s emails, including its email collection that was previously maintained on disc commonly referred to as Cable Archive Retrieval System. This reflects the Department’s effort to ensure as much permanently valuable email will be transferred to NARA as possible. The Department will not be applying GRS 6.1, item 011 or item 012 for temporary legacy emails created before December 31, 2016. The Department will be applying its other approved disposition authorities for these records pursuant to question 22, section B in the aforementioned FAQ.  Please note, the Department routinely communicated with its employees concerning their records management responsibilities through Cables and Department Notices which required each employee to print-and-file and/or cross-file email records.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of State, Foreign Service Posts
Additional Scope Comments: 1.  The Department may decide to use item 012 in the future and will submit a new form at that time.2.  Scope of RG 084 is for overseas posts only.  General State Department records are in RG 059.3.  Cutoff and transfer instructions for GRS 6.1, item 10 - Cut off at the end of tenure. Transfer to the National Archives 25 years after cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: The Department will be applying GRS 6.1 item 010 and item 011 beginning on December 31, 2016 and continuing day forward for all emails. Pursuant to question 22, section A in the aforementioned FAQ guidance, the Department will also be using GRS 23, item 7 as part of its culling strategy. The Department will be applying GRS 6.1, item 010 to any existing legacy senior official’s emails, including its email collection that was previously maintained on disc commonly referred to as Cable Archive Retrieval System. This reflects the Department’s effort to ensure as much permanently valuable email will be transferred to NARA as possible. The Department will not be applying GRS 6.1, item 011 or item 012 for temporary legacy emails created before December 31, 2016. The Department will be applying its other approved disposition authorities for these records pursuant to question 22, section B in the aforementioned FAQ.  Please note, the Department routinely communicated with its employees concerning their records management responsibilities through Cables and Department Notices which required each employee to print-and-file and/or cross-file email records.
